definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]

sentences.english: Reviewers tend to ignore video-on-demand releases.
sentences.chinese: 評論家傾向於忽視視頻點播發布。

sentences.english: Rear projection TV receives satellite TV program, High-quality VOD (video on demand).
sentences.chinese: 背投彩電接收衛星電視節目，優質VOD視頻點播。

sentences.english: T. Sanuki, Y. Asakawa, Design of a video-server complex for interactive television.
sentences.chinese: 郝敏，視頻點播服務器設計關鍵技術研究。

sentences.english: Whether accessed via cable television or the internet, video on demand is likely to grow.
sentences.chinese: 無論通過有線電視還是因特網，視頻點播均可能增長。
